Class Book

  • java.lang.Object
    • Book

  • public class Book
extends java.lang.Object
    A representation of a physical Book within a library program where books can be rented and returned. Includes both hardback and paperback books. Each book has its own title and author, and every Book is within the Ya Fiction genre.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int booksOnPlatform
      A running tally of how many books have been constructed
      static java.lang.String genre 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Copy Constructor creates a duplicate object for the given book

      Overloaded Constructor accepts values for title and author

    • Constructor Detail

      • Book

        public Book()
        Default constructor creates an Object of The Color Purple By Alice Walker. Books are immediately available after creation

      • Book

        public Book(java.lang.String title,
            java.lang.String author)
        Overloaded Constructor accepts values for title and author
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the book
        author - the author of the book (If multiple authors, pass in comma seperated String of names)

      • Book

        public Book(Book bookToCopy)
        Copy Constructor creates a duplicate object for the given book
        Parameters:
        bookToCopy - the Book Object you'd like to duplicate

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Two Books are equal if they share the same title and author(s). Availability is not considered in the equality asessment.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - the Object with which to compare a Book
        Returns:
        true if the Object is equal to this Book, false if not.
